business.headline: India lifted 171 million people from extreme poverty from 2012 to 2022: World BankRural extreme poverty dropped from 18.4 per cent to 2.8 per cent, and urban from 10.7 per cent to 1.1 per cent, narrowing the rural-urban gap from 7.7 to 1.7 percentage points.

Changing jobs? Check this EPFO update on PF transfersEffective January 2025, the requirement for employer approval in most transfer cases has been eliminated. Previously, PF balance transfers required coordination between source and destination EPFO offices, often causing delays.

E-commerce, crops, data storage top India-US trade deal negotiations: ReportDiscussions will now begin on issues such as market access for US farm goods, India's data localisation rules, and the role of big tech in e-commerce—areas that have previously proved politically sensitive in India.

Indian airlines may face turbulence as Pakistan closes its skiesPakistan has announced shutting its airspace to Indian carriers as tensions rise between the two neighbours following a deadly militant attack in Indian Kashmir earlier this week.

Samsung to invest Rs 1,000 crore in Tamil Nadu plant: ReportSamsung's Tamil Nadu factory currently employs over 2,000 people. In 2022–23, the plant contributed one-fifth of Samsung's Rs 1 lakh crore sales in India.
Sensex, Nifty close lower as rising India-Pakistan tension spooks investorsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 588.80 points to end at 79,212.53, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 207.35 points to end at 24,039.35.

Pahalgam terror attack casts big shadow on Kashmir's booming tourism economyKashmir was slowly rebuilding its image as a peaceful tourist destination after years of conflict, especially after the abrogation of Article 370 in August 2019.

Sebi revises cut-off timings for overnight mutual fund redemptions. Details hereSebi aims to make sure stock brokers and clearing members use client funds wisely by investing in secure overnight mutual fund schemes (MFOS).

Air India may buy 10 Boeing planes turned down by China: ReportThe ongoing trade tensions between the US and China, marked by steep duties above 100%, have impacted various sectors, even the aviation industry has taken a hit.
Pakistan Stock Exchange portal crashes amid rising geopolitical heatThe online portal of PSX showed a message saying "We'll be back soon," indicating that the website was temporarily unavailable.

Bengaluru resident shares costly homebuying mistake: 'Don't fall for FOMO'A social media user from Bengaluru shared that he has been living in Bengaluru for the past six years. Like many others, he moved to the city for better career opportunities. Despite being financially stable, he chose to rent rather than buy a flat. But the trouble started soon after.

Sensex, Nifty tank: Indo-Pak tensions trigger market crash. Check top losersSensex plunged over 1,000 points, while Nifty tanked over 300 points, falling below 24,000 as uncertainty prevailed over geopolitical tensions.

entertainment.headline: Ajay Devgn's father asked me to drink own urine to speed up recovery: Paresh RawalActor Paresh Rawal shared a surprising remedy he followed for an injury recovery - consuming his own urine. This revelation was made during a conversation with Lallantop, a sister channel of India Today.
Shah Rukh Khan to make his Met Gala debut in a Sabyasachi ensemble: ReportAccording to reports, Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan is set to debut at the Met Gala 2025, donning a Sabyasachi creation.

TV actor Navina Bole accuses Sajid Khan of misconduct, says he asked her to stripTV actor Navina Bole has come forward with allegations against filmmaker Sajid Khan, accusing him of inappropriate behaviour during a meeting. This adds to the growing list of accusations against Khan, who has been previously named in other misconduct cases.

Havoc review: Tom Hardy is the only saving grace in Gareth Evans' gore actionerReleased-Fri Apr 25, 2025Netflix's 'Havoc', directed by Gareth Evans, pairs Tom Hardy with a thrilling plot, but ultimately disappoints. Why? Read on and find out.

Fleeing Romania to being an Oscar nominee: Why Sebastian Stan is truly a starActor Sebastian Stan's journey from Romania to ruling the roost in Hollywood is anything but typical. From a childhood under a strict regime to becoming a celebrated actor, Stan's story is one of resilience and talent.

Ground Zero box office Day 2: Emraan Hashmi film picks pace, collects Rs 3 croreEmraan Hashmi's military drama 'Ground Zero' is witnessing growth at the box office despite facing competition from other Bollywood films. The film chronicles the story of BSF officer Narendra Nath Dhar Dubey's operation against terrorist mastermind Ghazi Baba.

The Diplomat OTT release: When, where to watch John Abraham's political thriller'The Diplomat', starring John Abraham, is reportedly set to premiere on Netflix on May 9, 2025. The film delves into the intricacies of diplomacy and personal conflicts, inspired by the true story of Indian diplomat JP Singh.

Sinners production designer reveals hidden tribute to Chadwick BosemanIn a recent interview, 'Sinners' production designer Hannah Bleacher unveiled a subtle tribute to Chadwick Boseman embedded in the film.

Woh gussa fir se jaaga hai: Akshay Kumar on Pahalgam attack at Kesari 2 screeningAkshay Kumar attended a screening of Kesari Chapter 2 and addressed the audience about the Pahalgam terror attack, expressing anger. He said that the anger Indians had after Jallianwala Bagh incident has been rekindled.

Justin Bieber's grandfather dies at 80. Singer, wife Hailey pay tributePop icon Justin Bieber mourns the loss of his grandfather, Bruce Dale, who died at 80. The singer shared a loving tribute on Instagram.

Kesari Chapter 2 box office Day 9: Akshay Kumar film sees jump, earns Rs 57 croreKesari 2, starring Akshay Kumar, R Madhavan, and Ananya Panday, is maintaining a good momentum at the box office. The film has already crossed Rs 50 crore mark and also witnessed a jump in numbers on Day 9.

Directors Khalid Rahman, Ashraf Hamza arrested for possession of hybrid ganjaDirector Khalid Rahman, who directed the recently-released film 'Alapuzzha Gymkhana' and director Ashraf Hamza, along with one other, were arrested for the possession of hybrid ganja by the Excise department of Kochi.

Madhuri Dixit's in-laws 'weren't happy' when husband Shriram Nene moved to IndiaMadhuri Dixit and her husband Dr Shriram Nene relocated to India after years in the USA, where Dr Nene had a successful medical career. Despite initial resistance from his parents, Dr Nene transitioned from being a heart surgeon to a medical-tech entrepreneur.

Waqt: An absurd masterpiece of earthquakes, epiphanies and Raaj Kumar at his best'Waqt', the 1965 blockbuster directed by Yash Chopra, is a quintessential masala film that blends drama, music, and a star-studded cast. Known for its engaging narrative and memorable performances, it remains a beloved classic in Hindi cinema.

Karthik Subbaraj on why romance is the soul of Suriya's RetroDirector Karthik Subbaraj, known for films like 'Pizza' and 'Jigarthanda', is shifting focus to romance in his latest venture 'Retro'. Starring Suriya, the film delves into love's transformative power against a vintage gangster backdrop.

AR Rahman, Ponniyin Selvan 2 makers face Rs 2 crore fine in copyright caseThe Delhi High Court has intervened in a copyright dispute involving composer A R Rahman and the film 'Ponniyin Selvan 2'. The court found Rahman's song identical to the Junior Dagar Brothers' Shiv Stuti.

Content creator Misha Agarwal dies two days before 25th birthdayInfluencer Misha Agarwal has passed away just days before her 25th birthday, leaving her followers and family in shock. The cause of her death is yet to be revealed.

Karisma sent people to spy on Raveena's look: Andaz Apna Apna designer AshleyThe beloved cult classic 'Andaz Apna Apna' returns to cinemas, bringing back memories for costume designer Ashley Rebello, who reminisces about creating iconic looks for the film's stars. He recounted a behind-the-scene anecdote before the shoot of the song 'Yeh Raat Aur Yeh Doori'.

Dan Da Dan S2 trailer promises more full-throttle action, quirk. WatchThe new trailer for Dan Da Dan's second season delves into the intense battle between Okarun and the possessed Jiji, promising an action-packed continuation. With familiar faces returning to the creative team, the series is set to stream from July 3 on Netflix and Crunchyroll.

general news.headline: Nothing to fear: Tourists return to Pahalgam days after terror strike killed 26Pahalgam is slowly returning to normal after the terror attacks, with both domestic and international tourists expressing confidence in the region's safety and continuing their travel plans.
2 children die after massive fire breaks out at jhuggi cluster in Delhi's RohiniA massive fire engulfed slums in Rohini. Bodies of two children under the age of three were recovered from the spot.

Senthil Balaji quits as Tamil Nadu Minister days after Supreme Court ultimatumTamil Nadu ministers V Senthil Balaji, who was facing a Supreme Court ultimatum in a money laundering case, and K Ponmudy, who came under fire for controversial religious remarks, resigned from the MK Stalin Cabinet.

RCB clinch record 6th away win as Krunal Pandya, Virat Kohli fire in DelhiIPL 2025, DC vs RCB: Krunal Pandya chipped in with an all-round show and Virat Kohli hit a solid fifty as RCB clinched a six-wicket win in Delhi on Sunday, April 27. It was RCB's sixth straight win away from home this season -- a new record in the tournament.

Video: Indian Navy warships fire missiles, display 'combat-ready' strike powerThe Indian Navy has conducted multiple mission exercises involving anti-ship firings of various missile systems. The exercise included the firing of Brahmos, one of the deadliest long-range missiles, along with medium and short-range missile systems. This demonstration of naval firepower comes in the wake of the Pahalgam attack, sending a strong message about India's combat readiness to safeguard its interests anywhere, anytime.

China backs Pakistan's 'independent probe' demand on Pahalgam terror attackThe Chinese Foreign Minister, Wang Yi, extended China's resolute support to Pakistan in its demand for an independent investigation over India's allegations about its involvement in the Pahalgam terror attack.

Terrorists trekked 22 hours through rough terrain for Pahalgam attack: SourcesTwo mobile phones - one belonging to a local resident and the other to a tourist - were snatched by the terrorists during the Pahalgam attack, sources said. Four attackers were involved in the carnage: three foreign terrorists and one local militant, Adil Thokar, sources added.

Is he BJP spokesperson?: Congress leader on Shashi Tharoor slamming Pak leaderCongress leader Udit Raj seemed to be indicating that Shashi Tharoor deviated from the party line over the Pahalgam attack, where it had questioned the security lapses and intelligence failures on the government's part.

Forget IPL contracts, gully cricket can help earn big money and fameFame and money in cricket isn't just in IPL or internationals. Even without playing professional cricket, scores of Indians are emerging as stars due to gully cricket. The Indian Street Premier League (ISPL), with an IPL-like model, revolutionised tennis-ball cricket. Not just ISPL, scores of tournaments in several states are attracting prominent organisers and sponsors, and promising big money.

In pics: Members of Indian community abroad hold protests against Pahalgam attackMembers of Indian communities in different countries are taking to the streets to express grief, resentment and anger against the incident, also holding protests.

Children, elderly in fear: Kashmir leaders urge Centre to stop house demolitionsHurriyat Conference chief Mirwaiz Umar Farooq and Jamaat-e-Islami leader Shamim Ahmad Thoker urged the authorities to halt the 'indiscriminate' destruction of houses, which, according to them, is affecting innocent families, women, children, and the elderly.

Pro-Pak slogans raised during Pahalgam attack protest in Bihar, one arrestedA video of a CPI leader allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans during a candlelight march for the Pahalgam terror attack went viral, leading to widespread criticism and police action.

TV actor Navina Bole accuses Sajid Khan of misconduct, says he asked her to stripTV actor Navina Bole has come forward with allegations against filmmaker Sajid Khan, accusing him of inappropriate behaviour during a meeting. This adds to the growing list of accusations against Khan, who has been previously named in other misconduct cases.

Terror attack or accident? Car rams crowd at Vancouver festival, at least 9 deadAt least 9 people have been killed in Vancouver after a car rammed a crowd. Videos that have emerged on social media from the scene show several bodies strewn across the street. A black SUV, which reportedly drove into the crowd, was seen beside a blue truck with a crushed bonnet, next to the crime scene.

Liverpool clinch 2nd Premier League title in Arne Slot's first year as coachLiverpool fans erupted at Anfield as Arne Slot's side secured the 2024-25 Premier League title with a commanding 5-1 victory over Tottenham, officially ushering in a new era after Jürgen Klopp's departure.

Jasprit Bumrah returns to best as Mumbai win 5 in a rowMumbai Indians beat Lucknow Super Giants by 54 runs to continue their incredible run in the Indian Premier League. This was Mumbai's 5th win in a row this season as they continue their sensational second half comeback in the tournament.
Shah Rukh Khan to make his Met Gala debut in a Sabyasachi ensemble: ReportAccording to reports, Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan is set to debut at the Met Gala 2025, donning a Sabyasachi creation.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Heart-broken: Teary-eyed Pak girl leaves Indian mother behind amid expulsionZainab, 11, and Zenish, 8, arrived in India with their mother, who holds an Indian passport, to meet their grandmother in Delhi last month. Little did they know that within a month, the situation between the countries would hit an all-time low.

10 killed as van falls into 'poisonous' well in Madhya PradeshA van carrying thirteen people fell into a well in Madhya Pradesh's Mandasur. Four people swam to safety while one died while attempting to rescue another.

Waqt: An absurd masterpiece of earthquakes, epiphanies and Raaj Kumar at his best'Waqt', the 1965 blockbuster directed by Yash Chopra, is a quintessential masala film that blends drama, music, and a star-studded cast. Known for its engaging narrative and memorable performances, it remains a beloved classic in Hindi cinema.

Rishabh Pant fined Rs 24 lakh hours after LSG's defeat in MumbaiIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: Rishabh Pant was fined Rs 24 lakh for his second-over rate offence in Lucknow Super Giants' match against the Mumbai Indians on April 27 at the Wankhede Stadium.

Tyres, stones thrown at Samajwadi Party MP's convoy in UP, Akhilesh Yadav reactsSamajwadi Party's MP Ramji Lal Suman's envoy got struck with tyres and stones while his convoy was crossing Aligarh. Karni Sena is alleged to be involved in the incident.

Tree-top video, Army officer's statement critical to Pahalgam terror probeThe NIA has launched a detailed probe into the Pahalgam terror attack, with a crucial video evidence from a local photographer and eyewitness testimony from an army officer to reconstruct how Pak-based terrorists brutally killed 26 people in the Baisaran Valley.

sports.headline: Mayank Yadav will bowl faster as he plays more in IPL 2025: Zaheer KhanIPL 2025: Lucknow Super Giants mentor and former India fast bowler Zaheer Khan on Sunday exuded confidence that express pacer Mayank Yadav's bowling speed will improve as he plays more matches in the IPL. The right-arm tearaway pacer Mayank made his comeback after a long injury lay-off, picking up two wickets against Mumbai Indians.

Watch: Virat Kohli teases KL Rahul, mimics iconic Chinnaswamy celebration in DelhiVirat Kohli brought light-hearted banter to RCB's big win over DC, cheekily mocking KL Rahul's "my home" celebration — with the two stars later sharing laughs as RCB continued their record-breaking away run in IPL 2025.

Kohli flaunts orthodox batting approach: Can't just come out and hitIPL 2025, DC vs RCB: Virat Kohli played a crucial role in Royal Challengers Bengaluru's six-wicket win over Delhi Capitals on Sunday at the Wankhede Stadium.

RCB clinch record 6th away win as Krunal Pandya, Virat Kohli fire in DelhiIPL 2025, DC vs RCB: Krunal Pandya chipped in with an all-round show and Virat Kohli hit a solid fifty as RCB clinched a six-wicket win in Delhi on Sunday, April 27. It was RCB's sixth straight win away from home this season -- a new record in the tournament.

Liverpool clinch 2nd Premier League title in Arne Slot's first year as coachLiverpool fans erupted at Anfield as Arne Slot's side secured the 2024-25 Premier League title with a commanding 5-1 victory over Tottenham, officially ushering in a new era after Jürgen Klopp's departure.

Rishabh Pant fined Rs 24 lakh hours after LSG's defeat in MumbaiIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: Rishabh Pant was fined Rs 24 lakh for his second-over rate offence in Lucknow Super Giants' match against the Mumbai Indians on April 27 at the Wankhede Stadium.

Need 50-50 balance: Shahrukh Khan on Rinku Singh's bold 300 commentIPL 2025, RR vs GT: In the pre-match press conference, Shahrukh Khan responded to Rinku Singh's comments, saying that teams cannot plan their batting strategies before assessing the conditions.

Hardik Pandya, Nita Ambani snap special selfie with school kids at WankhedeHardik Pandya and Nita Ambani captured a heart-warming selfie with 19,000 schoolchildren after Mumbai Indians extended their winning streak to five matches with a dominant victory over Lucknow Super Giants.

Pant responds to critics after Mumbai flop-show: Not going to question myselfIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: Captain Rishabh Pant said he was not doubting himself despite enduring a lean patch in the season. Pant was dismissed for 4 off 2 deliveries as Lucknow failed 55 runs short of a 216-run target in Mumbai on Sunday.

Pratika Rawal reaping the rewards after 'years of hard work'IND-W vs SL-W: 24-year-old Pratika Rawal made an unbeaten 50 off 62 balls as India beat Sri Lanka by nine wickets on Sunday, April 27, at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

IPL 2025: LSG's Ravi Bishnoi celebrates wildly after smashing six off BumrahRavi Bishnoi pulled off an ecstatic air-punch celebration after hitting a rare six off Jasprit Bumrah during LSG's IPL 2025 clash against Mumbai Indians, creating a light-hearted moment even as his side faced an eventual heavy defeat on Sunday.

Need 50-50 balance: Shahrukh Khan on Rinku Singh's bold 300 commentIPL 2025, RR vs GT: In the pre-match press conference, Shahrukh Khan responded to Rinku Singh's comments, saying that teams cannot plan their batting strategies before assessing the conditions.

Hardik Pandya, Nita Ambani snap special selfie with school kids at WankhedeHardik Pandya and Nita Ambani captured a heart-warming selfie with 19,000 schoolchildren after Mumbai Indians extended their winning streak to five matches with a dominant victory over Lucknow Super Giants.

Pant responds to critics after Mumbai flop-show: Not going to question myselfIPL 2025, MI vs LSG: Captain Rishabh Pant said he was not doubting himself despite enduring a lean patch in the season. Pant was dismissed for 4 off 2 deliveries as Lucknow failed 55 runs short of a 216-run target in Mumbai on Sunday.

Pratika Rawal reaping the rewards after 'years of hard work'IND-W vs SL-W: 24-year-old Pratika Rawal made an unbeaten 50 off 62 balls as India beat Sri Lanka by nine wickets on Sunday, April 27, at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

IPL 2025: LSG's Ravi Bishnoi celebrates wildly after smashing six off BumrahRavi Bishnoi pulled off an ecstatic air-punch celebration after hitting a rare six off Jasprit Bumrah during LSG's IPL 2025 clash against Mumbai Indians, creating a light-hearted moment even as his side faced an eventual heavy defeat on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
